channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Emma Raducanu: US Open champion 'does not want to let go' of trophy
item.description: Emma Raducanu says she does not want to let go of the US Open trophy as her fairy tale in New York culminates in the ultimate happy ending.

item.title: Queen praises Raducanu's 'outstanding' performance
item.description: The Queen leads the congratulations to Emma Raducanu after the 18-year-old Briton clinches the US Open title with victory against Leylah Fernandez.

item.title: Reading Minster: Man arrested on suspicion of churchyard rape
item.description: A woman in her 20s was attacked near Reading Minster in the early hours.

item.title: Brighton Marathon organisers apologise over course that was too long
item.description: Organisers of the event said they hoped it had not "marred the experience" for runners.

item.title: World's largest container ship arrives at Felixstowe
item.description: The Ever Ace, which is 400m-long (1,300ft) and can carry 23,992 containers, is on her maiden voyage.

item.title: Rhamero West: Stab victim killed on day he started college
item.description: The family of Rhamero West, who was killed after a chase, says he died on the day he started college.

item.title: Clacton stabbing: Two men, three boys and woman held in murder probe
item.description: The victim, a 21-year-old man, died in hospital after suffering a fatal wound, police say.

item.title: Captain Tobias: Sheffield boy, 10, completes Ironman challenge
item.description: Tobias Weller, who has cerebral palsy and autism, has raised more than Â£150,000 for charity.

item.title: Six charged over cocaine seizure off Plymouth coast
item.description: A British man and five Nicaraguan nationals are accused of drug-trafficking offences.

item.title: Teenager arrested after woman's body found in Leicester house
item.description: Officers say an 18-year-old has been arrested and they are not looking for anyone else.

item.title: Callum Baker-Osborne: Family of man swept out to sea want beach shut
item.description: Callum Baker-Osborne's family says there should be "a lot more" warning of potential dangers.

item.title: The chilling day the swastika flew beside the union jack
item.description: The image may be the only time the union jack was pictured together with the swastika in Britain.

item.title: Fabrice Muamba's son 'faced racist chants' in school rugby game
item.description: A top school is investigating after Fabrice Muamba says his son was abused during a rugby game.

item.title: Photographer's images 'like ghosts coming out the mist'
item.description: Guy Bellingham uses a 170-year-old technique to produce striking photos in remarkable detail.

item.title: Great North Run 2021: Thousands take part as event returns
item.description: The 40th edition of the world's biggest half-marathon sees 57,000 take on the route in Tyneside.

item.title: What it's like to be given a zoo as a gift
item.description: Roughly 40% of the animals at Rutland Zoo come from other rescues.

item.title: Covid: The Chelmsford bench telling women's stories of the pandemic
item.description: Pippa Bloom, who had to shield due to Covid, says sharing her experience was "almost therapeutic".

item.title: 9/11: 'All we could see was smoke in the distance'
item.description: A couple reflect on how close they came to being caught up in the devastation of the 9/11 attacks.

item.title: West Midlands Police apologises for failing domestic abuse victim
item.description: Suzanne Van Hagen's family say they have fought for more than eight years to get the truth.

item.title: Leeds urban farm helps young people grow fresh food
item.description: Young people in Leeds are working with a charity to grow fresh produce and learn new skills.

item.title: Danny Hodgson: Parents of footballer in coma make bedside visit
item.description: Danny Hodgson's parents are granted a compassionate visit amid tight Australian Covid restrictions.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Plane protest over sex assault claim
item.description: A plane showing support for a woman who accused the player of rape flies over Old Trafford.

item.title: Didsbury Mosque: Police investigate fire as hate crime
item.description: Mosque leaders says they are "so grateful" to neighbours who tried to put out the blaze with coats.

item.title: Finsbury Park mosque attacker fears eye loss after prison stabbing
item.description: The Finsbury Park mosque attacker was stabbed by an inmate while serving a life sentence for murder.

item.title: Manager 'sickened' by alleged abuse of goalkeeper
item.description: Alleged racial abuse of Colchester keeper Shamal George during their game at Barrow is 'sickening', says U's boss Hayden Mullins.

item.title: Liverpool arms fair: Corbyn and Peake join protest
item.description: The former Labour leader joined protesters calling for Liverpool to cancel the event.

item.title: Italian GP: Lewis Hamilton & Max Verstappen collide as Daniel Ricciardo wins for McLaren
item.description: McLaren's Daniel Ricciardo won the Italian Grand Prix after a harrowing crash between title rivals Lewis Hamilton and Max Verstappen.

item.title: Chelsea 4-0 Everton: Blues showed 'statement of intent' in WSL win over Everton
item.description: Chelsea winger Erin Cuthbert says the defending Women's Super League champions showed "a statement of intent" after bouncing back from their opening-day defeat with a comfortable victory over Everton.

item.title: Ryder Cup: Lee Westwood seals spot in European team
item.description: Lee Westwood seals his spot in the European team for this month's Ryder Cup as nine automatic qualifiers are confirmed after the BMW PGA Championship.
